abstracts.cdata!:
The Bank has made available a
            substantial amount of resources for Cameroon's economic
            and social development and has helped shape economic and
            social policy in the country. In spite of the difficult
            political context, the Government has taken courageous
            measures as part of its economic reform program. Although
            these efforts merit support, government's demonstrated
            willingness to pursue reforms, in spite of political
            problems, is essential to continued the International
            Development Association's (IDA) support. As proposed in
            the strategy, IDA will continue to support a coherent set of
            reforms and will play the catalytic role of mobilizing other
            donors' support to fill the gap left by IDA. Under the
            assumption that implementation of the reform program will
            stay on track and that Cameroon will live up to its
            commitments under the Economic Recovery Credit Project and
            its economic reform program, IDA will pursue the
            implementation of reforms in macroeconomic management,
            including public procurement reform in collaboration with
            Cameroon's other partners. The IDA lending program will
            support Cameroon's efforts to attain these goals.
